required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of GlaxoSmithKline (GSK)134612 in Subjects With Increased Risk for Meningococcal Disease Versus Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity and Safety Study of GSK Biologicals' Meningococcal Vaccine GSK 134612 Administered to at Risk Subjects From 1 to Less Than 18 Years

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the immunogenicity, reactogenicity and safety of the new meningococcal vaccine 134612 in subjects with increased risk of meningococcal disease and compare it to its activity in healthy subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: For each at risk subject enrolled, an age-matched healthy subject will be enrolled. Age matching will be performed according to the following age strata: 1-5 years, 6-10 years, 11-17 years.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Vaccine Response for Serum Bactericidal Assay Using Rabbit Complement Against Neisseria Meningitides Serogroups A, C, W-135 and Y (rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135, rSBA-MenY) Antibodies
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the first vaccine dose (at Month 1)
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: rSBA antibody titers greater than or equal to (≥) 1:32, for initially seronegative subjects [i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers below (<) 1:8] and at least a 4-fold increase in rSBA antibody titers from pre to post-vaccination, for initially seropositive subjects (i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers ≥ 1:8).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Vaccine Response for Serum Bactericidal Assay Using Human Complement Against N. Meningitides Serogroups A, C, W-135 and Y (hSBA-MenA, hSBA-MenC, hSBA-MenW-135, hSBA-MenY) Antibodies
primary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the first vaccine dose (at Month 1)
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: hSBA antibody titers ≥ 1:8, for initially seronegative subjects (i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers < 1:4) and at least a 4-fold increase in hSBA antibody titers from pre to post-vaccination, for initially seropositive subjects (i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers ≥ 1:4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Vaccine Response for rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135 and rSBA-MenY Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the second vaccine dose (At Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: rSBA antibody titers ≥ 1:32, for initially seronegative subjects (i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers < 1:8) and at least a 4-fold increase in rSBA antibody titers from pre to post-vaccination, for initially seropositive subjects (i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers ≥ 1:8).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Vaccine Response to hSBA-MenA, hSBA-MenC, hSBA-MenW-135 and hSBA-MenY Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: One month after the second vaccine dose (At Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: hSBA antibody titers ≥ 1:8, for initially seronegative subjects (i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers < 1:4) and at least a 4-fold increase in hSBA antibody titers from pre to post-vaccination, for initially seropositive subjects (i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers ≥ 1:4).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135, rSBA-MenY Titers ≥ the Cut-off Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-primary vaccination (Month 0), at post first vaccine dose (Month 1) and post second vaccine dose (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for the assay was ≥ 1:8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135, rSBA-MenY Titers ≥ the Cut-off Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-primary vaccination at Month 0, post first vaccine dose at Month 1 and post second vaccine dose at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for the assay was ≥ 1:128.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Titers for rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135, rSBA-MenY Meningococcal Antigens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-primary vaccination (Month 0), post first vaccine dose (Month 1) and post second vaccine dose (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody titers were measured in geometric mean titers (GMTs), calculated on all subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With hSBA-MenA, hSBA-MenC, hSBAMenW-135 and hSBA-MenY Titers ≥ the Cut-off Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-primary vaccinarion (Month 0), post first vaccine dose (Month 1) and post second vaccine dose (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for the assay was ≥ 1:4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With hSBA-MenA, hSBA-MenC, hSBAMenW-135 and hSBA-MenY Titers ≥ the Cut-off Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-primary vaccinarion (Month 0), post first vaccine dose (Month 1) and post second vaccine dose (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for the assay ≥ 1:8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Titers for hSBA-MenA, hSBA-MenC, hSBA-MenW-135 and hSBA-MenY Meningococcal Antigens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-primary vaccination at Month 0, post first vaccine dose at Month 1 and post second vaccine dose at Month 3
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody titers were measured in Geometric mean titers (GMTs), calculated on all subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PSA, Anti-PSC, Anti-PSW-135 and Anti-PSY Antibody Concentrations ≥ the Cut-off Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-primary vaccinarion (Month 0), post first vaccine dose (Month 1) and post second vaccine dose (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for the assay was ≥ 0.3 micrograms per milliliter (μg/m).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Anti-PSA, Anti-PSC, Anti-PSW-135 and Anti-PSY Antibody Concentration ≥ the Cut-off Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-primary vaccinarion (Month 0), post first vaccine dose (Month 1) and post second vaccine dose (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: The cut-off value for the assay was ≥ 2.0 μg/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Antibody Titers for hSBA-MenA, hSBA-MenC, hSBA-MenW-135 and hSBA-MenY Meningococcal Antigens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-primary vaccinarion (Month 0), post first vaccine dose (Month 1) and post second vaccine dose (Month 3)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody titers were measured in geometric mean concentrations (GMCs), calculated on all subjects.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms at Age Stratum 1-5 Years
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 30 millimeters (mm) of injection site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms at Age Stratum 6-17 Years
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any was defined as occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain was defined as cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 redness/swelling was defined as redness/swelling spreading beyond 30 millimeters (mm) of injection site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms at Age Stratum 1-5 Years
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability, loss of appetite and fever. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptoms = symptoms which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 fever = oral temperature >39.5 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms at Age Stratum 6-17 Years
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, headache and fever. Gastrointestinal symptoms include nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea and/or abdominal pain. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptoms = symptoms which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 fever = oral temperature >39.5 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Month 0 until the end of the Extended Safety Follow-Up [ESFU] (at Month 8)
secondary_outcome.description: NOCIs include autoimmune disorders, asthma, type 1 diabetes and allergies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) post first vaccination period
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited adverse event (AE) covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical subject investigation temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. Any was defined as an AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study. Also any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms was reported as an unsolicited AE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited AEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) post second vaccination period
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical subject investigation temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. Any was defined as an AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study. Also any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms was reported as an unsolicited AE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Month 0 until the end of the ESFU (at Month 8)
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

arm_group.description: The subjects in the Healthy group will be age-matched to the subjects in the At-risk group. Subjects will receive 2 doses of the investigational vaccine.
This group includes subjects with medical conditions placing them at an increased risk for meningococcal disease. Subjects will receive 2 doses of the investigational vaccine.

intervention.description: 2 doses of the vaccine administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who the investigator believes that parent(s)/Legally Acceptable Representative(s) [LAR(s)] can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol.
- A male or female 1 to 17 years of age at the time of the first vaccination.
- Written informed consent obtained from the parent(s)/LAR(s) of the subject and informed assent obtained from the subject, if appropriate, prior to enrolment.
- Female subjects of non-childbearing potential may be enrolled in the study.
- Female subjects of childbearing potential may be enrolled in the study, if
- the subject has practiced adequate contraception for one month (30 days) prior to the first vaccine dose, and
- has a negative pregnancy test on the day of vaccination, and
- has agreed to continue adequate contraception from administration of the first vaccine dose until 2 months after administration of the second vaccine dose.
Additional inclusion criterion for At-risk group • Subjects with an increased risk for meningococcal disease, such as anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia or complement deficiencies.
Additional inclusion criteria for Healthy group
- Healthy subject as established by medical history and clinical examination before entering into the study.
- Age-matched to a subject from the At-risk group according to age strata 1-5 years, 6-10 years and 11 to 17 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Child in care.
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product other than the study vaccine within 30 days preceding the first dose of study vaccine, or planned use during the study period (until the phone contact at Month 8).
- Planned administration/administration of a vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol during the period starting 30 days before administration of each study vaccine dose until 30 days after administration of each study vaccine dose. Administration of licensed inactivated influenza vaccines is allowed as per local recommendations.
- Concurrently participating in another clinical study, at any time during the study period, in which the subject has been or will be exposed to an investigational or a non-investigational product.
- History of meningococcal disease.
- Any confirmed or suspected Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) infection, based on medical history and physical examination.
- Administration of immunoglobulins and/or any blood products within the 3 months preceding the first dose of study vaccine until one month after the second dose of study vaccine.
- History of any reaction or hypersensitivity likely to be exacerbated by any component of the vaccine including latex.
- Major congenital defects.
- History of any neurological disorders or seizures, including Guillain-Barré syndrome (GBS). History of a simple, single febrile seizure is permitted.
- Acute disease and/or fever at the time of enrolment.
- Pregnant or lactating female.
- History of chronic alcohol consumption and/or drug abuse.
- Female planning to become pregnant or planning to discontinue contraceptive precautions.
Additional exclusion criteria for the At-risk group
• Vaccination against meningococcal disease of any serogroup
- within the last 3 years for subjects younger than 7 years.
- within the last 5 years for subjects 7 years and older.
Additional exclusion criteria for the Healthy group
- Vaccination against meningococcal disease of any serogroup with polysaccharide or conjugate vaccine within the last 5 years.
- Chronic administration of immunosuppressants or other immune-modifying drugs within 6 months prior to the first vaccine dose.
- Family history of congenital or hereditary immunodeficiency.
- Any confirmed or suspected immunosuppressive or immunodeficient condition.
- Serious chronic illness.
- History of asplenia or hyposplenia or complement deficiencies.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: During the screening the following steps occurred: check for inclusion/exclusion criteria, contraindications/precautions, medical history of the subjects and signing informed consent forms.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group
group.description: Male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, with an increased risk for meningococcal disease due to anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

group.title: Nimenrix Healthy Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2, administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group
group.description: Male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, with an increased risk for meningococcal disease due to anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

group.title: Nimenrix Healthy Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2, administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With a Vaccine Response for Serum Bactericidal Assay Using Rabbit Complement Against Neisseria Meningitides Serogroups A, C, W-135 and Y (rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135, rSBA-MenY) Antibodies
outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: rSBA antibody titers greater than or equal to (≥) 1:32, for initially seronegative subjects [i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers below (<) 1:8] and at least a 4-fold increase in rSBA antibody titers from pre to post-vaccination, for initially seropositive subjects (i.e. pre-vaccination rSBA antibody titers ≥ 1:8).
outcome.time_frame: One month after the first vaccine dose (at Month 1)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all eligible subjects who complied with the blood sample schedule for Visit 2 (Month 1) and Visit 4 (Month 3), for whom data concerning immunogenicity endpoint measures were available for at least one antigen component of the vaccine.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group
group.description: Male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, with an increased risk for meningococcal disease due to anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135, rSBA-MenY Titers ≥ the Cut-off Values
measure.description: The cut-off value for the assay was ≥ 1:128.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the ATP cohort for immunogenicity, which included all eligible subjects who complied with the blood sample schedule for Visit 2 (Month 1) and Visit 4 (Month 3), for whom data concerning immunogenicity endpoint measures were available for at least one antigen component of the vaccine.

outcome.title: Antibody Titers for rSBA-MenA, rSBA-MenC, rSBA-MenW-135, rSBA-MenY Meningococcal Antigens
outcome.description: Antibody titers were measured in geometric mean titers (GMTs), calculated on all subjects.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms at Age Stratum 1-5 Years
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 30 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented and with their symptom sheet filled in.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group
group.description: Male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, with an increased risk for meningococcal disease due to anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

group.title: Nimenrix Healthy Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2, administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms at Age Stratum 1-5 Years
measure.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 30 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented and with their symptom sheet filled in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms at Age Stratum 6-17 Years
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any was defined as occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain was defined as cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 redness/swelling was defined as redness/swelling spreading beyond 30 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented and with their symptom sheet filled in.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group

group.title: Nimenrix Healthy Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2, administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Symptoms at Age Stratum 6-17 Years
measure.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any was defined as occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain was defined as cried when limb was moved/spontaneously painful. Grade 3 redness/swelling was defined as redness/swelling spreading beyond 30 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented and with their symptom sheet filled in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms at Age Stratum 1-5 Years
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability, loss of appetite and fever. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptoms = symptoms which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 fever = oral temperature >39.5 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented and with their symptom sheet filled in.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group
group.description: Male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, with an increased risk for meningococcal disease due to anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

group.title: Nimenrix Healthy Group
group.description: Healthy male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2, administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms at Age Stratum 1-5 Years
measure.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were drowsiness, irritability, loss of appetite and fever. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptoms = symptoms which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 fever = oral temperature >39.5 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented and with their symptom sheet filled in.

class.title: Any Loss of appetite, Across doses
Grade 3 Loss of appetite, Across doses
Related Loss of appetite, Across doses

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any, Grade 3 and Related Solicited General Symptoms at Age Stratum 6-17 Years
outcome.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, headache and fever. Gastrointestinal symptoms include nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea and/or abdominal pain. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 symptoms = symptoms which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 fever = oral temperature >39.5 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period following each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented and with their symptom sheet filled in.

measure.description: Assessed solicited general symptoms were fatigue, gastrointestinal symptoms, headache and fever. Grade 3 symptoms = symptoms which prevented normal everyday activities. Grade 3 fever = oral temperature >39.5 °C. Related = symptom assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented and with their symptom sheet filled in.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
outcome.description: NOCIs include autoimmune disorders, asthma, type 1 diabetes and allergies.
outcome.time_frame: From Month 0 until the end of the Extended Safety Follow-Up [ESFU] (at Month 8)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group
group.description: Male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, with an increased risk for meningococcal disease due to anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Reporting New Onset of Chronic Illnesses (NOCIs)
measure.description: NOCIs include autoimmune disorders, asthma, type 1 diabetes and allergies.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects Reporting Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An unsolicited adverse event (AE) covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical subject investigation temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product. Any was defined as an AE reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study. Also any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms was reported as an unsolicited AE.
outcome.time_frame: During the 31-day (Days 0-30) post first vaccination period
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group
group.description: Male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, with an increased risk for meningococcal disease due to anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2. The vaccine was administered intramuscularly in the anterolateral thigh muscle of the non-dominant leg for subjects aged 12 months to 2 years and in the deltoid of the non-dominant arm for older subjects.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
outcome.time_frame: From Month 0 until the end of the ESFU (at Month 8)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total Vaccinated cohort, which included all subjects with the vaccine administration documented.

group.title: Nimenrix At-Risk Group
group.description: Male or female subjects, aged 1 to 17 years of age, with an increased risk for meningococcal disease due to anatomic asplenia or some degree of functional asplenia, who received 2 doses of the Nimenrix vaccine at Month 0 and Month 2. reported_events.time_frame: Solicited local and general symptoms: during the 4-day (Days 0-3) post-vaccination period, Unsolicited AEs: during the 31-day (Days 0-30) post-vaccination period; SAEs: from Month 0 up to the end of the ESFU Phase (at Month 8).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
